lead_paragraph: Patrick Roy will have his No. 33 retired by the Montreal Canadiens, ending a bitter falling out. Roy, a Hall of Fame goaltender, played 11 seasons in Montreal, leading the Canadiens to Stanley Cup titles in 1986 and 1993. In 1995, he allowed nine goals before being pulled in a 12-1 loss to Detroit. Believing he had been left in to be humiliated by Coach Mario Tremblay, Roy said he would never play for the Canadiens again. A few days later he was traded to the Avalanche. Roy’s jersey will be raised to the rafters on Nov. 22 when the Canadiens host the Bruins.
